intro: Senecio keniophytum, commonly known as the Kenia leaf or Kenia plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has slender, upright stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio keniophytum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its elegant appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
